page.title: 18TOLL BAR END
page.content: Toll Bar End is a former hamlet that grew up around a{Toll Gate}on the London road. In recent years it has been absorbed by Coventry. A number of cottages and a school still survive among the modern housing estates. Today Toll Bar End's claim to fame is also linked to roads. For here the {A45(T) "Coventry Bypass"}and the {London rd.}from the city centre meet. A road also provides a link to the Siskin Drive Industrial Estate and Coventry Airport at Baginton. There are{plans}to build a road from this junction around the eastern edge of Coventry to link up with the M6/M69 Junction. The planned{"Eastern Bypass" has faced severe{local opposition because of fears of increased pollution and the knocking down of houses in the area. Despite the opposition building is to start soon.
